page.title: 19Sparham Pools
page.content: Sparham Pools Nature Reserve is owned by Major Sayer, a local resident and keen advocate of conservation of wildlife, who leases this disused gravel pit to the Norfolk Naturalists Trust. This Trust first became interested when the Little Ring Plover was found to have chosen this site as one of the first places in Britain to nest. Two islands have been cleared bare to successfully provide nesting sites for Common Terns, it is also an important place for migrating birds, e.g. Sandpiper, Greenpiper and Oyster Catcher. Kingfisher and Osprey are other interesting visitors. The nearby conifer wood is the location of a Heronry of 12 nests the young from which use the pool to fish. The Warden keeps the site in good repair and gives guided tours to parties from the Trust and Young Ornithologists Club.
